text: Chrysopsis lanuginosa, called the Lynn Haven goldenaster, is a North American species of flowering plant in the aster family. It has been found only in the Florida Panhandle.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Chrysopsis lanuginosa is a perennial herb up to 10 cm (40 inches) tall. It generally produces only one stem for each rosette of leaves. Both the leaves and the stem are covered with white woolly hairs. Each stalk can produce as many as 80 yellow flower heads and a loose array. The species grows in sandy and grassy locations.Flora of North America, Highlands goldenaster, Chrysopsis Lynn Haven goldenaster Small Small, John Kunkel 1933. Manual of the Southeastern Flora 1339, 1508 ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Endemic flora of Florida Category:Plants described in 1933 Category:Taxa named by John Kunkel Small
title: Chrysopsis lanuginosa
